intro: Lindera benzoin var. aestivalis, commonly known as summer spicebush, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that emit a spicy scent when crushed. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds. This variety is often found in moist woodlands and thrives in partial to full shade.
